title: Hoisin-Glazed Chicken with Cabbage Slaw
summary: Hoisin-Glazed Chicken with Cabbage Slaw might be just the main course you are searching for. This gluten free and dairy free recipe serves 4 and costs $2.31 per serving. One serving contains 279 calories, 38g of protein, and 5g of fat. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. Head to the store and pick up cabbage, soy sauce, scallions, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 25 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 75%. This score is pretty good. Try Lime And Soy-glazed Chicken With Cabbage Slaw, Roasted Hoisin Glazed Cabbage, and Chicken Stir-fry With Yams, Red Cabbage, And Hoisin for similar recipes.
instructions: Heat broiler on high. Rinse the cutlets and pat dry with paper towels. Pound the cutlets to an even thinness. Place on a broiler pan. In a small bowl, whisk together the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, 1 teaspoon of the rice vinegar, and the fish sauce (if using). Transfer 2 tablespoons of the glaze to a large bowl and stir in the remaining rice vinegar. Add the cabbage, peppers, scallions, and cilantro and toss. Cover and refrigerate. Pour about 1 tablespoon of the remaining glaze into a small bowl; set aside as a finishing sauce. Brush the chicken with the glaze that remains. Broil, brushing occasionally, until cooked through, 5 to 8 minutes. Spoon the reserved glaze over the top. Serve with the slaw.

steps.step: Heat broiler on high. Rinse the cutlets and pat dry with paper towels. Pound the cutlets to an even thinness.
Place on a broiler pan. In a small bowl, whisk together the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, 1 teaspoon of the rice vinegar, and the fish sauce (if using).
Transfer 2 tablespoons of the glaze to a large bowl and stir in the remaining rice vinegar.
Add the cabbage, peppers, scallions, and cilantro and toss. Cover and refrigerate.
Pour about 1 tablespoon of the remaining glaze into a small bowl; set aside as a finishing sauce.
Brush the chicken with the glaze that remains. Broil, brushing occasionally, until cooked through, 5 to 8 minutes. Spoon the reserved glaze over the top.
